newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Rouble dips, o/n still high ahead of T-bill sales.
newsitem.headline: Rouble dips, o/n still high ahead of T-bill sales.

text.p: The rouble edged down on Tuesday after early steadiness as banks sought funds for Wednesday's Treasury bill auctions, which are keeping overnight credit rates high, dealers said.
On Wednesday the central bank is auctioning 7.5 trillion
roubles of one-year paper and 4.5 trillion roubles of
roubles/dollar Feb 25 midday Feb 25 early Feb 24 close
"Banks were selling dollars rather actively in the morning. They are getting ready for the auctions, it could hardly be anything else," one dealer said.
Neftekhimbank dealer Vladimir Zrazhevsky said rouble demand of Russian banks was limited by low yields on government securities. T-bills are currently yielding 24-32 percent.
